content.title: 人々はこれがLove Islandのコンテストに呪いがあることを証明していると思っています -  Her.ie
content.desc: Could it be? Last night,Love Islandfans' hearts were broken when this series' winner, Dani Dyer, confirmed that she had split from her co-star boyfriend, Jack Fincham. Taking to her Instagram Stories, Dani said the pair had"come to the realisation that it's not meant to be long term" and were planning to stay friends post-split. Some fans took to social media to wonder if there was some kind ofLove Island"curse" on the winners, noting that 2017's winners, Kem Cetinay and Amber Davies, announced their own split around the same time last year. Others, meanwhile, wondered if there was just a c...

content.title: 愛の島のクリスマスの再会のための予告編はここにあり、それはすべて非常に、非常に厄介な -  Her.ie
content.desc: Oh dear. Love Islandfans were heartbroken last night as it emerged that this year's winners, Jack Fincham and Dani Dyer, had split. Dani confirmed in a since-deleted statement thatthey had "come to the realisation that it's not meant to be long term." Which made it all the more awkward when the first trailer for theLove IslandChristmas special debuted just a few hours later. The footage shows the now-former couple cuddled up and exchanging gifts, before cutting to them happily dancing together. You can watch the trailer below. content.desc: Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have announced their separation just over four months after winning Love Island 2018. content.title: ITVはLove IslandのスポンサーであるThe Guardianを£3.5m誘う
content.desc: ITV is hoping to attract a new multimillion-pound sponsor for Love Island when the next batch of romance-seeking millennials hit screens next summer. The most recent series of Love Island, won by Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham, proved to be TV gold, smashing viewing records and providing the nation’s watercooler moments over the summer. Superdrug has been the headline sponsor of the past three series of the Majorca-set reality TV show, which the company has credited with driving sales of products including bronzer. But the retailer has decided not to sign up for a fourth year. ITV has put the s...

content.title: 愛島の勝者ダニ・ダイアーとペン・アドバイス・ブック -  Independent.ie
content.desc: Love Island winner Dani Dyer has signed a deal for her debut book, in which she will offer advice and answer questions. In What Would Dani Do?, Dyer will share her experiences of growing up, bullying, relationships, insecurities and being soap star Danny Dyer’s daughter. She will also provide behind-the-scenes details from Love Island, where she met boyfriend Jack Fincham. Dani Dyer with Jack Fincham (Ian West/PA) The book will be published by Ebury Publishing on April 4 2019. The reality star said: “My followers are always asking me questions and advice on everything from family to boys t...

content.title: Love Island star Megan：セックス教育を教えさせてください -  Independent.ie
content.desc: Love Island finalist Megan Barton Hanson has said she wants to teach sex education in schools. The glamour model and former stripper, 24, suggested the classes could be filmed for a reality television show. “Sex education is really important and I want to go back to school to teach kids and answer questions they might be too embarrassed or shy to ask their teachers,” she told the Sun on Sunday. Megan Barton-Hanson wants to teach sex education (PA) “Schools have a responsibility, as do their parents, to teach their kids. “I think if it’s awkward and weird coming from a much older teacher, it...
